result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A Schabow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.  Defendant must contact the Clark County Sheriff's Department within 48 hours to schedule and complete at the date and time designated by the Sheriff's Department, the booking process, which includes fingerprinting and photos.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Prosecutor Richard R. Lewis and Defendant, Michael A Schabow appeared, pro se  Defendant finalized  waiver of  right to an attorney after full colloquy

Speical Prosecutor Richard R. Lewis appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Michael A Schabow appeared, pro se.  Defendant is in receipt of complaint.    Defendant advised of right to an attorney.  Defendant would like to speak to the DA today.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2016 at 10:10 am.
